intro: Scrophularia viciosoi, commonly known as the false foxglove, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture. Scrophularia viciosoi is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
